answers.text: the condition of having at least three loose or liquid bowel movements each day

qas.question: What is one of the effects of diarrhea?

answers.text: can result in dehydration due to fluid loss

qas.question: What are the warning signs of dehydration?

answers.text: loss of the normal stretchiness of the skin and irritable behaviour

qas.question: What are other signs of dehydration?

answers.text: decreased urination, loss of skin color, a fast heart rate, and a decrease in responsiveness

qas.question: What condition is characterized by loose and watery stools in babies?
What sign begins with a loss of skin color and a fast heart rate?

plausible_answers.text: loss of the normal stretchiness of the skin and irritable behaviour

qas.question: What are the warning signs of diarrhea?

plausible_answers.text: It often lasts for a few days
decreased urination, loss of skin color, a fast heart rate, and a decrease in responsiveness

qas.question: What are other signs of diarrhea?

context: <b4_0>Diarrhea<b4_0/>, also spelled diarrhoea, is <a0_0>the condition of having at least three loose or liquid bowel movements each day<a0_0/>. <b7_0>It often lasts for a few days<b7_0/> and <a1_0>can result in dehydration due to fluid loss<a1_0/>. Signs of <b5_0>dehydration<b5_0/> often begin with <a2_0><b6_0>loss of the normal stretchiness of the skin and irritable behaviour<b6_0/><a2_0/>. This can progress to <a3_0><b8_0>decreased urination, loss of skin color, a fast heart rate, and a decrease in responsiveness<b8_0/><a3_0/> as it becomes more severe. Loose but non-watery stools in babies who are breastfed, however, may be normal.
